name: The Embassy Row Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in Nov 2012 at short notice, running away from Hurricane Sandy. The location, just off Dupont Circle, is in the embassy district with lots of restaurants and bars very close, which clearly were a major social centre for the residents. Our purpose was to see the sights of Washington, and its location for that was good. It is about 20 mins walk from the White House, and on a convenient Metro line.
reviews.title: Excellent base for a tourist visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel itself is very well appointed and the service was good. The room was reasonably sized, given a capital city, and was clean and well maintained. We had got a very good deal, booking at the last minute, so it turned out to be extraordinarily good value for a capital city. An excellent stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is on a quiet residential street a block from Dupont Circle, so shopping and fine dining are steps away, but the immediate area is peaceful. My room was on the small side, as this is an older hotel, but was clean and comfortable. The TV and cable system need an upgrade. Bathroom tiny but spotless. Excellent check-in experience; continental breakfast offered with limited options.
reviews.title: Perfectly situated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location (Dupont Circle) - lots of restaurants and bars - A very lively neighborhood- Service was excellent. The hotel is clean and the staff were very friendly. We arrived on a Sunday and needed to park in the hotel which was on the expensive side. Breakfast is included in your price.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service during Hurricane Sandy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Embassy Row Hotel Washington in November 2012 during Hurricane Sandy, the staff were excellent and helped us all they could during a worrying time. We were only B&B at the hotel but on the Mon & Tue when the hurricane struck they supplied hot food at lunch & dinner for all the guests. Thanks to all the staff.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel was my occasional discovery. The location turned out to be perfect. It's not far from lovely Georgetown where we usually walked 15-20 minutes. It's one subway station from the White House. The subway station - dupont circle - is just around the corner.
reviews.title: perfect location, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are lots of restaurants, cafes and clubs around as well as all possible embassies. The room was big, beds were comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone going to DC and I would like to come back there myself.
reviews.title: Very, very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: p.s. Smoking rooms should be banned.
reviews.title: Nice stay; good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for four nights at the Embassy Row Hotel, 2015 Massachusetts Ave., Washington, D. C. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast (included) was more than adequate. The location is very convenient to the DuPont Circle Metro station, making all of DC easily accessible. We even walked to the White House. When we return to DC (can't see all of it in one short trip) I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Handy location, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Good location; close to the Metro. We traveled to Washington by Amtrak. A car is not necessary to travel around this city and the parking costs at the hotels are very expensive. The hotel staff was very accommodating and the room price was average for this area. We were there during Hurricane Sandy and, though the hotel could not get their housekeeping staff to work during the height of the storm, they did manage to furnish the guests with fresh towels and toiletries. The complimentary breakfast was good and the facility was very clean. It is noisy if you stay over on a Saturday night. The music goes on until 11 PM. Also not far to Georgetown; a good walk or short cab ride.
reviews.title: Hotel would rather have a raging party than provide peace and quiet for guests. HORRIBLE STAY.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: The pros: best location. Two minutes from metro. Great diverse restaurants everywhere. Safe neighborhood. King standard room was very spacious, clean, and updated. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Room rate was incredible so don't complain about the minimalist free breakfast. If you want more, take the money you saved on the room rate and go outside the hotel.
reviews.title: What a great location! I'd stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The cons: parking is expensive at $35 a night plus $6 tax, but lots in the area are more for overnight parking.
reviews.title: Nothing beside the (average) room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was a great value for what I paid.
reviews.title: Unhappy Camper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: The room is just fine. Average size, wide bed... No complaint. However, if you expect any additional services: sorry, not there.
reviews.title: Terrible customer service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: If you get thirsty at night, there is no mini-bar in your room. There is no room service either. If you're lucky enough and have enough change, you can use vending machines on some floors.
reviews.title: Needs some renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: While the location of this hotel is good, close to subway and lots of different fast-foodish options, it has some gaping faults that detract from the experience of any traveller (for business or pleasure).
reviews.title: Needs an update

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is dreary and dingy and desperately needs an update, the hallways smell like dirty and old hotel hallways..maybe the carpets are musty. There is no bar of restaurant of any kind: if you arrive later at night, you are skipping dinner or you have to venture out into the neighborhood (not the best, but I will get to that). Breakfast is a sad affair: no eggs or other hot items, just cereal, bread and bagels with a toaster and plastic plates/cups/utensils. Sad.
reviews.title: Great for a city break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A scary looking guy tried to sell me drugs on the corner near the hotel. This makes me think that the neighborhood is not so nice, or bordering on sketchy. Would not walk around alone at night, as a woman.
reviews.title: good choice for a visit to washington

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The good points that save the experience from being a total failure? The staff is very kind and helpful, and the maid service does a great jobkeeping the dingy rooms clean.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There must be something better at this price!
reviews.title: good deal for a two night stay

description: In the heart of Dupont Circle in Washington, DC, The Embassy Row Hotel is immersed in the historical charm of DC's rowhomes and dining scene. Admire the architectural beauty of embassies near the hotel and easy access to the Dupont Circle metro/Red Line. This DC hotel is a few minutes from the White House, Washington Monuments, WWII Memorial, the Philips Collection, The Capitol, The Smithsonian Institute, famous museums, and historical attractions. Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport is only 7 miles away. For guests traveling by rail, there is convenient access to Amtrak/Union Station. When you aren't exploring the city, enjoy yourself on The Rooftop at The Embassy Row Hotel. It's expansive views of DC will make you fall in love with the city, all over again.
